document.docAuthor: Colombo, Wesley D. & Azevedo, Celso O.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Dissomphalus Ashmead, 1893 (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae) from Espíri- to Santo, Brazil, with description of twenty-one new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Dissomphalus Ashmead, 1893 (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae) from Espíri- to Santo, Brazil, with description of twenty-one new species

bibRefCitation.author: Evans
bibRefCitation.refString: Evans, H. E. (1964) A synopsis of the American Bethylidae (Hymenoptera, Aculeata). Bulletin of the Museum of Comparative Zoology, 132, 1 - 222.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dissomphalus plaumanni
Evans, 1964 : 47
, 52, 58–59 (Ƌ, holotype from Santa Catarina, BMNH, figs 19, 27, 32, 35);
Azevedo, 1999b : 939
–941; 2003: 26–27;
Redighieri & Azevedo, 2004 : 330
; 2006: 312.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Male. Head black, mesosoma nearly black. Mandible with four apical teeth. Median clypeal lobe trapezoidal. Frons coriaceous, punctures large, shallow. Vertex slightly convex, rounded corner. T2 with pair rounded lateral depressions, each onetubercles, tuft of setae directed back- and inward, anterior margin depression with some setae. Genitalia: paramere very wide; cuspis thick; digitus with rounded dorsal expansion; aedeagal ventral ramus laminar, surface horizontal, very short, as short as basiparamere, wide, apex acute; aedeagal dorsal body with pair of apical lobes, laminar, wide, apex rounded in lateral view, compressed in dorsal view, inner surface stout, membranous and setose; genital triangular. Female unknown.

Remarks. Seventy-one specimens of
D. plaumanni
were registered from Espírito Santo (Azevedo, 2003; Redighieri & Azevedo, 2006 ), and we add more 198 new ones.

Material examined.
